Dr. John Patangan

Dr. Patangan received his D.M.D. (Doctor of Dental Medicine) degree from Tufts University School of Dental Medicine in Boston, MA in 1999. While there, he was awarded a full scholarship under the Navy’s Health Professions Scholarship Program and commissioned in the US Navy Dental Corps. Following dental school, Dr. Patangan proceeded to Rota, Spain for his first tour of duty. He was then accepted into the pediatric dental residency at Indiana University Riley Children’s Hospital in Indianapolis in 2006 and completed his Masters Degree and Certificate of Specialty in 2008.

Upon completing his specialty training Dr. Patangan was stationed in Okinawa Japan treating family members of Navy and Marine Corps service members stationed overseas. While there he was the head pediatric dentist and his duties included overseeing and mentoring general dentists and other health care providers as well as caring for patients with special needs. He continues to serve as a Navy Reservist in Indianapolis. Dr. Patangan is a member of the American Dental Association, Indiana Society of Pediatric Dentists and the American Academy of Pediatric Dentistry. He became a Board Certified Pediatric dentist in 2010. Dr. Patangan and and his wife Angela live in Bloomington with their daughter and twin boys. He enjoys spending time with his three children as well as hiking and working out.
